intro: Codonophora lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
